The underground and underwater shots are impressive and really transport you into the cramped and frightening/tense positions that these kids and divers experienced. Ron Howard does a great job of capturing this real life story in a tense and gripping way, and the entire cast also delivers. But what really elevates this movie is the overwhelming inspiration that you just can't help but feel as you watch these events unfold. It's a story of people from all over the world coming together and putting their own selves aside in order to save lives. This film shows us the beauty of humanity, which is especially resonate today. The story of the Tham Luang cave rescue is an incredible one, and it's not always easy to translate real life events like this into film. But I think that this movie absolutely delivered and brings a thrilling, emotional, and deeply inspirational film that highlights what true heroes look like in the real world. It might be a bit long, and it starts to get a little repetitive with the diving scenes. I also wish that we could've gotten some more time with the kids while they were stranded in the cave. But overall, I was glued to my screen from start to end and genuinely moved by this film.

An Absolute Must See! Salute to the diving hero for saving kids. One of the best true events I have seen.
Mind-blowing, gripping, intriguing!
Excellent filmmaking, extraordinary production, a must-watch if you like rescue films and biopics of this genre.
I didn't even pay attention to the drama, action or characters.  Sure, that was all fine, but the whole time I was riveted to my seat going 'holy crap holy crap holy crap'.

I'm surprised that the reviews are so favorable. It's not a bad movie but the documentary on the same story, The Rescue, is wildly more detailed and emotional. I found this to be gripping but was confused on how many details it glossed over which created context that was confusing to piece together. If you want to really get blown away by the sheer insane bravery of this story, watch The Rescue - its a better use of your time.

Incredible! Why wasn't this released for a theatrical run?!?

One of Ron Howard's best...EVER.

Talk about a film for our times. The initial politics of local authorities afraid of losing face, is quickly resolved but the sheer selfless co-operation and teamwork by so many to get those children out (and their coach). Plus the stranded Thai navy seals. 
Using common sense and ingenuity to tackle every issue. The direction from Howard gives a sense of the claustrophobia of those tunnels. Good pacing throughout the key points of the story. As you know the ending from the start (unless you lived in a cave back in 2018) it's the how - which is fascinating.
Both Farrell and Mortensen play middle aged Englishmen effortless. At the heart of this story is just how lacking in ego both characters are. Their focus is the job - no Hollywood cliche fist pumps here. 
It ultimately is a story about ordinary people pulling together under extreme circumstances. From the local area, neighbouring countries and further afield. It is hard not to shed a tear throughout the film. 
Custard creams all arounds.
Watched it unravel on the news, but the real truth the pu lic was not told. Eye opening and bravery, exceptional cast, Ron Howard does it again and again, a master of film making.
One of the best films I've seen in the last year!!
A little bit long but it's a really good film.

I really enjoyed this movie, it shows the impossible can be done and all humans come together to help anyway they can, I only watched this bc the ratings were good, and yes this movie is very long but I wasn't ever bored watching this movie so watch it you won't be disappointed

I absolutely loved this film by Ron Howard! Thirteen Lives is based on the true story of thirteen people who got stuck in a flooded cave in Thailand in the summer of 2018. The storyline is action-packed and extremely suspenseful. It felt like my heart was racing a million miles a minute while I watched it.  
 
Thirteen Lives takes us on the journey of twelve boys and their soccer coach getting stuck in the Tham Luang cave in northern Thailand. The boys wanted to visit the cave; however, little did they know that there was an approaching monsoon that would soon after flood the entire cave. People from all over the world were watching their rescue attempt with the many challenging obstacles they had to overcome. Will someone find them inside the cave? If they do, will the boys get out of the cave in time before they starve, or run out of oxygen?
 
The acting in this film is phenomenal. The portrayal of these young boys, their coach and their rescuers is so believable that you feel like you are there along with them. The cast includes Colin Farrell as John Volanthen, Viggo Mortensen as Richard Stanton, Joel Edgerton as Richard Harris and Tom Bateman as Chris Jewell. The production team, led by director Ron Howard also delivered. The way the film is made makes you feel like you're actually in the cave with the rescue workers. It took a lot of effort and coordination, which is very impressive. Over 5,000 people, including cave divers, doctors, rescuers, Navy SEALS, farmers and others contributed to helping the boys. They put their own lives at risk to help the boys and their coach, whom they didn't even know! Without those people playing a part in this rescue who knows if they would have saved them. My favorite part is when the farmers give up their crops so water can flood them and divert the water from going into the cave. It took a lot of heroism and sacrifice to lose their entire crop in order to give the boys a better chance of surviving.
 
The message of this film is that working together is essential. You should be aware that there is a lot of blood in some scenes and there is some bad language used a couple of times.
 
I give Thirteen Lives 5 out of 5 stars and recommend it for ages 12 to 18, plus adults. This film releases in select theaters on July 29, 2022, and starts streaming on Prime Video August 5, 2022. By Sydney S., KIDS FIRST!

Gripping, intense, and a triumph of the human spirit. A case study in courage that captures a remarkable real life story of international collaboration and sacrifice. The underwater work is a technical achievement. A must watch in theaters for the sound design alone.
This movie reminds me of the Chilean miners story, it's almost like this is some tangential sequel, in my opinion.
I thought this was well done in every way. A very gripping film. It really gave me a new appreciation for the effort that went into trying to save these boys.

This film is FANTASTIC. I was completely absorbed in the story. There is nothing contrived or pushed in the re-telling of this very intense true story. The performances are all excellent. The direction is spectacular. I felt like I was there in realtime, as it was all happening. Really worth a watch. High art.
Up there with Apollo 13 as one of Howard's best. The cinematography is anxiety-inducing and incredibly effective. The performances were stellar all across the board.
Exciting start to finish.  like true stories and this one was done excellent much in part to the great directing by Ron Howard.
Amazing watching this event beat for beat.
Excellent film, providing depth to a real story with star studded performance! Another great work by director Ron Howard.

Ron Howard's latest film is a thrilling drama about the true life rescue of a group of youth soccer players who are trapped in a cave after flooding in Thailand.  They do a really good job with recreating the cave and the situation and even though we know what happens from news reports, the suspense and drama is still felt.  The film is currently playing in select theaters ahead of an Amazon Prime release next week.
Wow !! A must see I love that we found out stuff hidden from the public. This was so good and kept you on edge even know we all know the ending !  Amazing acting
